body:
version 9.18
node 1 - ubuntu 14
node 2 - freebsd 10
node 3 - freebsd 10 (hdd disconnected)
node 4 - android 4.2
node 5 - windows XP
Yes, but what version of syncthing? There was a bug with this that was fixed in 0.9.18.

I always thought that this is quite known thing, but you can reproduce it easily by umounting shared directory:
- mount anything to /tmp/test
- add repo, set /tmp/test as path
- umount /tmp/test
- bang, repo wiped :)

Archlinux 64 / Win7, syncthing v0.9.18

Funny. It is the problem for me. :-(
Node 3 get error access to directory - must be stop syncing.
I not right?
So could the issue be the fact that a folder (repo) root is pointed directly at the mount point? This way the repo dir still exists though content is gone, making syncthing think its a version bump
Yes. That's indistinguishable from you deleting all files - how would it know the difference? But if the repo path is _missing_, it'll realize there's an error.

We could place a `.stfolder` file at the root upon adding the repo (Before the first scan probably)
When that is missing, we know we are screwed.

1. folder for repo not mount point.
2. May be used directory .stversions as flag for signal error or normal work?

How about treating sudendly empty repo as special case and asking user, if he did it in UI?
Something like "Warning: Empty repo stopped, click here to resume"
and add big button "restore last state" :-)
In BTSync use repo id in directory repo for detect correct folder.

rename.from: Clearing repo if not access to HDD
rename.to: Warn/complain/stop if all files have disappeared

issue.title: Erased files because repository is on external hard drive

labels.name: frozen-due-to-age
labels.description: Issues closed and untouched for a long time, together with being locked for discussion

issue.body:
I have a desktop and a laptop.
I have many GBs of files on my desktop and I have shared them with my laptop. The repositories are created so that any change on one place will update the other.
However the files on my desktop are on an external hard drive.
When I disconnected my drive, Syncthing decided that I have deleted all my files on the desktop so it removed all my files on the laptop too.
That was devastating. It was all OK for the desktop when I reconnected my drive, but now transferring all this GBs to my laptop will take ages (again).

body:
I have one (I hope) theoretical question about this issue. What happens, if user reconnects (remounts) suddenly missing drive/directory? Wouldn't be previous "_everything is empty_" state considered as more recent as any file on reconnected drive, causing syncthing to wipe even this last backup?

Because if that is the case, I'm prerry sure that it's bound to happen to someone, sooner or later...
@calmh do you have an opinion on having this `.stinit` or some file to indicate that the repo is in an acceptable state?
I guess having the file empty would be sufficient to guard against this specific case, and allow us have multiple folders to point at the same path.
